alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Keya Paha; Rock; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherry, northwestern Rock, northeastern Hooker, Brown, northwestern Blaine, northern Thomas and western Keya Paha Counties through 1145 PM CDT/1045 PM MDT/... At 1056 PM CDT/956 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Keyapaha to 16 miles southeast of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 6 miles west of Thedford. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Ainsworth, Springview, Thedford, Long Pine, Halsey, Johnstown, Seneca, Purdum, Brownlee, Norden, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Elsmere, Wood Lake, Hofeld Lake, Raven, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area and Smith Falls State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 196 and 250. Highway 2 between mile markers 193 and 231. Highway 97 between mile markers 140 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 142 and 215. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Keya Paha; Rock; Thomas; Western Cherry
